description: Configure the balancers for the Kubernetes cluster. Currently, only the Haproxy configuration can be customized.

haproxy.description: The section contains the configuration parameters that are applied to the haproxy.cfg config file, and also some Kubemarine related parameters

keep_configs_updated.description: Allows Kubemarine update haproxy configs every time, when cluster (re)installed or it's schema updated (added/removed nodes)

config.description: Custom haproxy config value to be used instead of the default one

config_file.description: Path to the Jinja-template file with custom haproxy config to be used instead of the default one

global.description: Parameters that are passed directly to the 'global' section of haproxy.cfg file.

maxconn.description: Set the total number of connections allowed, process-wide.

defaults.description: Parameters that are passed directly to the 'defaults' section of haproxy.cfg file.

timeout_connect.description: Set the maximum time to wait for a connection attempt to a server to succeed

timeout_client.description: Set the maximum inactivity time on the client side

timeout_server.description: Set the maximum inactivity time on the server side

timeout_tunnel.description: Set the maximum inactivity time on the client and server sides for tunnels

timeout_client_fin.description: Set the inactivity timeout on the client side for half-closed connections

maxconn.description: Limits the sockets to this number of concurrent connections

target_ports.description: The section contains the information about http/https ports, which are used in connection from balancers to worker nodes
